Posts.Content: odat4me wrote: Just found out today that I have breast cancer. I had a biopsy this Tuesday. I had a feeling from the way the doctor spoke to me before the biopsy that it was cancer but I still had hope. I am looking forward to seeing her again on July 31. I wish it were sooner. She says we have time. I do whatever it takes Dx 7/31/2018, IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 8/9/2018 Lumpectomy: Right Hormonal Therapy 9/23/2018 Femara (letrozole) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Glad I had my mammogram odat4me odat4me

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2018 06:31PM odat4me wrote: Thank you for your message. You will be in my thoughts too. I had cancer when I was a teenager. I remember how fast I had wanted to get rid of it get it out of my body. I am so sorry you have to wait for the biopsy
Posts.Title: Glad I had my mammogram odat4me odat4me

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2018 06:37PM odat4me wrote: Thank you! I did get a copy of the report it is hard to understand! I have IDC too on the right. How do you get your diagnosis on your posts? My doctor also wrote 2 pages for me while she was explaining everything. She was very thorough but it was very overwhelming. I was glad I don’t need Chemotherapy upfront. I had chemo for my bone cancer in the 80s. If I do end up needing it I can deal with it.
Posts.Title: How long safe to wait ? Jadedjo odat4me

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2018 09:07AM odat4me wrote: I am anxious as well to get things moving along and have the same fears as you. I found out a week ago Friday. My breast surgeon was away this week and I am going to see her Tuesday. Check out the book Breasts an owners guide by Kristi Funk (a well known breast surgeon in CA). She does write about wait time I think ideally you should get treatment going within 3 months of diagnosis there is a slight change with recurrence rate after that time period. I hope we both get what need ASAP
Posts.Title: How long safe to wait ? Jadedjo odat4me

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2018 07:36AM odat4me wrote: I got some answers yesterday. Confused a little by what the surgeon said about receptors. She said it was what they want to hear. Looking forward to surgery next Thursday, lumpectomy. Part of me wonders about mastectomy. Still going to wait to hear about BRCA results too. I think it is good to try to get cancer out ASAP.
Posts.Title: How long safe to wait ? Jadedjo odat4me

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2018 02:23PM odat4me wrote: Thank you for all of the posts! I am so thankful to have this community. It stinks more then words can say that any of us have rob go through this. I am nervous about tomorrow, finding out the specifics of my cancer. I keep flipping back and forth with feeling really positive and then thinking horrible outcomes. I survived childhood cancer 30 years ago, very aggressive bone cancer. I had the cancer out within weeks of diagnosis and thankfully after a year of chemotherapy I survived. Can I manage that again?
Posts.Title: How long safe to wait ? Jadedjo odat4me

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2018 03:52PM odat4me wrote: thank you edwards750!
Posts.Title: How long safe to wait ? Jadedjo odat4me
How long safe to wait ? Jadedjo odat4me

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2018 12:36PM odat4me wrote: I was just diagnosed too. Most mornings I feel pretty sad and negative. By the middle of the day I shake off those bad feelings. I have been reading a book that has helped me a lot. Breasts, an owners manual. It has helped explained a lot of what to expect.

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2018 01:13AM odat4me wrote: 47. First breast cancer in my family that I know of. Also had bone cancer as a teen

Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2018 11:52AM odat4me wrote: I am actually in same day surgery right now going in shortly for my lumpectomy. Thinking of all of you today! Waiting a bit since she is in surgery with another woman. I have been reading the posts and following everyone’s journey. Trying to think about changing my diet to help with survival too, it seems so overwhelming
